messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Battle Maps
messages.msgSnippet: ... Hi Edy Well unfortunately not everything of value and use is to be found on the internet and the local library or bookshop (there are some of those on the
messages.messageBody:
>----- Original Message -----
>From: Edward Alexander
>Sent: Sunday, December 12, 2004 11:06 Am
>
>Thanks Rod.But where can I find on the Internet??????
>
>Edy :-)

Hi Edy

Well unfortunately not everything of value and use is to be found on the internet and the local library or bookshop (there are some of those on the internet!) is still needed..

Since you are interested in Kawanakajima I should add a further Turnbull Osprey Title to the others ie. "Kawanakajima 1553-64" in the Campaign series. This once again has good maps and 3D views of battle plans.

Cheers,
Rod :-)


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Battle Maps
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks Rod.But where can I find on the Internet?????? Edy :-) shogun.uk  wrote:Yahoo! Groups Survey Please help us to improve Yahoo!
messages.messageBody:
Thanks Rod.But where can I find on the Internet??????

Edy :-)



"shogun.uk" <shogun.uk@...> wrote:Yahoo! Groups Survey
Please help us to improve Yahoo! Groups. Take the survey now!

--- Edward Alexander <edyhiphop@...> wrote:

>
> Hey guys.....
> Sorry cuz I didn't respond to any message because
> I'm busy with school. I'm asking for something. I
> need it at History....... Can you give me some
> information about battle maps???? I mean, just like
> in WWII. Maps of the area where the battles took
> place.

Edy--

Hi Eddy and everybody

Sorry I have not been around for a while, my work on the Shimabara Rebellion and the graphic works on the "heradry" have taken longer that anticipated (plus other thing getting in the way!!)

So Battle Maps; as Nate replied all depends on your interest... However, I could point you to a couple of the Osprey Series, reasonably cheap and readily available. The two are Nagashino 1575, by Stephen Turnbull, and Sekigahara 1600, by "our own" Anthony Bryant. Both have reasonable two dimentional maps and excellent 3D section maps. Good as a starter?

Cheers,
Rod :-)

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Battle Maps
messages.msgSnippet: Nate, I want battle maps from the Sengoku(especially Sekigahara).But also I want the Kawanakajima(all of them). Thanks, Edy ... Edy-- Can you be more specific?
messages.messageBody:
Nate,

I want battle maps from the Sengoku(especially Sekigahara).But also I want the Kawanakajima(all of them).

Thanks,
Edy

Edy--

Can you be more specific? What battles would you like?
I'm sure someone can help, but there were quite a lot
of battles in Japan over the centuries--what battle do
you want?

messages.messageBody:
Hey guys.....
Sorry cuz I didn't respond to any message because I'm busy with school. I'm asking for something. I need it at History....... Can you give me some information about battle maps???? I mean, just like in WWII. Maps of the area where the battles took place.

Peace,
Edy

P.S.:
Mr. Gabriel,
I'm also romanian.


Eddy
